greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Least number of odd squares that sum to n.
link: Charles R Greathouse IV, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: For n == 1 (mod 8), if n is a perfect square, a(n) = 1, otherwise a(n) = 9.
For n == 2 (mod 8), if n is a term in A097269, a(n) = 2, otherwise a(n) = 10.
For positive integer x, a(72*x+42) = a(72*x+66) = 10. (End)
maple: A101412 := proc(n) local lsq; lsq := [seq((2*j+1)^2,j=0..floor((sqrt(n)-1)/2))] ; lsq := convert(lsq,set) ; a := n ; for p in combinat[partition](n) do if convert(p,set) minus lsq = {} then a := min(a,nops(p)) ; fi; od: a ; end: for n from 1 do printf("%d,\n",A101412(n)) ; od: # _R. J. Mathar_, Aug 08 2009
a:= proc(n) option remember; local r; r:= isqrt(n);
mathematica: a[n_] := a[n] = Module[{r}, r = Sqrt[n]; If[IntegerQ[r] && OddQ[r], 1, Min[Table[a[i]+a[n-i], {i, 1, Floor[n/2]}]]]]; Table[a[n], {n, 1, 105}] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Mar 19 2014, after _Alois P. Heinz_ *)
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Aug 08 2009
